page.title: 19THE LONDON GLIDING CLUB
page.content: The London Gliding Club situated at the foot of Dunstable Downs is the largest in the country. The steep west-facing slope of the Downs forms an obstruction to the prevailing wind, and produces an upcurrent. As many as twenty gliders at a time can use this wind. The club, formed in 1930, has 450 members. It employs instructors and ground engineers but basic work is done by volunteers. Members can fly solo after about fifty flights with instructors. Gliders are launched by a small winch or towed up by a small areoplane. Hang gliders also are use the downs, but are regared as a dangerous nuisance by the Gliding Club.
